blocks.content: Extend class notation with the set of closed sets of a topology.
blocks.origin: const class ccld { Clsd }

diff.ccld.c

diff.cnt.c
diff.cnt.w

blocks.content: Extend class notation with closure of a subset of a topology base set.

diff.ccl.c
diff.ccl.w
df-cld
blocks.content: Define a function on topologies whose value is the set of closed sets of the topology. (Contributed by NM, 2-Oct-2006.)

blocks.name: df-ntr
blocks.content: Define a function on topologies whose value is the interior function on the subsets of the base set. See ~ ntrval . (Contributed by NM, 10-Sep-2006.)

blocks.name: df-cls
blocks.content: Define a function on topologies whose value is the closure function on the subsets of the base set. See ~ clsval . (Contributed by NM, 3-Oct-2006.)

blocks.name: fncld
blocks.content: The closed-set generator is a well-behaved function. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 1-Feb-2015.)

blocks.name: cldval
blocks.content: The set of closed sets of a topology. (Note that the set of open sets is just the topology itself, so we don't have a separate definition.) (Contributed by NM, 2-Oct-2006.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 11-Nov-2013.)
blocks.origin:
thm cldval(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, ctop), wceq(cfv(ccld, c0), crab(s0, cpw(c1), wcel(cdif(c1, cv(s0)), c0))))
  -| wceq(c1, cuni(c0))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
} = {
  mpdan(wcel(c0, ctop), wceq(cfv(ccld, c0), crab(s0, cpw(c1), wcel(cdif(c1, cv(s0)), c0))), wcel(crab(s0, cpw(c1), wcel(cdif(c1, cv(s0)), c0)), universe))
  3syl(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(crab(s0, cpw(c1), wcel(cdif(c1, cv(s0)), c0)), universe), wcel(c1, c0), wcel(cpw(c1), universe))
  topopn(c0, c1)
  pwexg(c1, c0)
  rabexg(s0, cpw(c1), universe, wcel(cdif(c1, cv(s0)), c0))
  fvmptg(hs0, c0, ctop, crab(s0, cpw(c1), wcel(cdif(c1, cv(s0)), c0)), universe, ccld, crab(s0, cpw(cuni(cv(hs0))), wcel(cdif(cuni(cv(hs0)), cv(s0)), cv(hs0))))
  rabeqbidv(s0, cpw(cuni(cv(hs0))), cpw(c1), wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cdif(cuni(cv(hs0)), cv(s0)), cv(hs0)), wcel(cdif(c1, cv(s0)), c0))
  pweqd(cuni(cv(hs0)), c1, wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  mpancom(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wb(wcel(cdif(cuni(cv(hs0)), cv(s0)), cv(hs0)), wcel(cdif(c1, cv(s0)), c0)), wceq(cdif(cuni(cv(hs0)), cv(s0)), cdif(c1, cv(s0))))
  difeq1d(cuni(cv(hs0)), cv(s0), c1, wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  syl6eqr(cuni(cv(hs0)), c1, cuni(c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  unieq(cv(hs0), c0)
  eleq12(cdif(cuni(cv(hs0)), cv(s0)), cdif(c1, cv(s0)), cv(hs0), c0)
  df-cld(hs0, s0)
  diff.cpw.s(s0, c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(ctop)
  diff.hs0.c(crab(s0, cpw(c1), wcel(cdif(c1, cv(s0)), c0)))
  diff.cpw.s(s0, cuni(cv(hs0)))
  diff.cuni.s(s0, cv(hs0))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(hs0), c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm cldval(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà Top ‚Üí(Clsd ` c0)= { s0 ‚àà P(c1)|(c1 \ s0)‚àà c0 })
  ‚ä£ c1 = ‚ãÉ c0
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c1)
} = {
  mpdan(c0 ‚àà Top, (Clsd ` c0)= { s0 ‚àà P(c1)|(c1 \ s0)‚àà c0 }, { s0 ‚àà P(c1)|(c1 \ s0)‚àà c0 } ‚àà ùïå)
  3syl(c0 ‚àà Top, { s0 ‚àà P(c1)|(c1 \ s0)‚àà c0 } ‚àà ùïå, c1 ‚àà c0, P(c1)‚àà ùïå)
  topopn(c0, c1)
  pwexg(c1, c0)
  rabexg(s0, P(c1), universe, (c1 \ s0)‚àà c0)
  fvmptg(hs0, c0, ctop, { s0 ‚àà P(c1)|(c1 \ s0)‚àà c0 }, universe, ccld, { s0 ‚àà P(‚ãÉ hs0)|(‚ãÉ hs0 \ s0)‚àà hs0 })
  rabeqbidv(s0, P(‚ãÉ hs0), P(c1), hs0 = c0, (‚ãÉ hs0 \ s0)‚àà hs0, (c1 \ s0)‚àà c0)
  pweqd(‚ãÉ hs0, c1, hs0 = c0)
  mpancom(hs0 = c0, ((‚ãÉ hs0 \ s0)‚àà hs0 ‚Üî(c1 \ s0)‚àà c0), (‚ãÉ hs0 \ s0)=(c1 \ s0))
  difeq1d(‚ãÉ hs0, s0, c1, hs0 = c0)
  syl6eqr(‚ãÉ hs0, c1, ‚ãÉ c0, hs0 = c0)
  unieq(hs0, c0)
  eleq12((‚ãÉ hs0 \ s0), (c1 \ s0), hs0, c0)
  df-cld(hs0, s0)
  diff.cpw.s(s0, c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(ctop)
  diff.hs0.c({ s0 ‚àà P(c1)|(c1 \ s0)‚àà c0 })
  diff.cpw.s(s0, ‚ãÉ hs0)
  diff.cuni.s(s0, hs0)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, hs0, c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: ntrfval
blocks.content: The interior function on the subsets of a topology's base set. (Contributed by NM, 10-Sep-2006.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 11-Nov-2013.)
blocks.origin:
thm ntrfval(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, ctop), wceq(cfv(cnt, c0), cmpt(s0, cpw(c1), cuni(cin(c0, cpw(cv(s0)))))))
  -| wceq(c1, cuni(c0))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
} = {
  mpdan(wcel(c0, ctop), wceq(cfv(cnt, c0), cmpt(s0, cpw(c1), cuni(cin(c0, cpw(cv(s0)))))), wcel(cmpt(s0, cpw(c1), cuni(cin(c0, cpw(cv(s0))))), universe))
  3syl(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(cmpt(s0, cpw(c1), cuni(cin(c0, cpw(cv(s0))))), universe), wcel(c1, c0), wcel(cpw(c1), universe))
  topopn(c0, c1)
  pwexg(c1, c0)
  mptexg(s0, cpw(c1), universe, cuni(cin(c0, cpw(cv(s0)))))
  fvmptg(hs0, c0, ctop, cmpt(s0, cpw(c1), cuni(cin(c0, cpw(cv(s0))))), universe, cnt, cmpt(s0, cpw(cuni(cv(hs0))), cuni(cin(cv(hs0), cpw(cv(s0))))))
  mpteq12dv(s0, cpw(cuni(cv(hs0))), cuni(cin(cv(hs0), cpw(cv(s0)))), cpw(c1), cuni(cin(c0, cpw(cv(s0)))), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  pweqd(cuni(cv(hs0)), c1, wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  syl6eqr(cuni(cv(hs0)), c1, cuni(c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  unieq(cv(hs0), c0)
  unieqd(cin(cv(hs0), cpw(cv(s0))), cin(c0, cpw(cv(s0))), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  ineq1(cv(hs0), c0, cpw(cv(s0)))
  df-ntr(hs0, s0)
  diff.cpw.s(s0, c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(ctop)
  diff.hs0.c(cmpt(s0, cpw(c1), cuni(cin(c0, cpw(cv(s0))))))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(hs0), c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm ntrfval(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà Top ‚Üí(int ` c0)=(s0 ‚àà P(c1)‚Ü¶ ‚ãÉ(c0 ‚ãÇ P(s0))))
  ‚ä£ c1 = ‚ãÉ c0
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c1)
} = {
  mpdan(c0 ‚àà Top, (int ` c0)=(s0 ‚àà P(c1)‚Ü¶ ‚ãÉ(c0 ‚ãÇ P(s0))), (s0 ‚àà P(c1)‚Ü¶ ‚ãÉ(c0 ‚ãÇ P(s0)))‚àà ùïå)
  3syl(c0 ‚àà Top, (s0 ‚àà P(c1)‚Ü¶ ‚ãÉ(c0 ‚ãÇ P(s0)))‚àà ùïå, c1 ‚àà c0, P(c1)‚àà ùïå)
  topopn(c0, c1)
  pwexg(c1, c0)
  mptexg(s0, P(c1), universe, ‚ãÉ(c0 ‚ãÇ P(s0)))
  fvmptg(hs0, c0, ctop, (s0 ‚àà P(c1)‚Ü¶ ‚ãÉ(c0 ‚ãÇ P(s0))), universe, cnt, (s0 ‚àà P(‚ãÉ hs0)‚Ü¶ ‚ãÉ(hs0 ‚ãÇ P(s0))))
  mpteq12dv(s0, P(‚ãÉ hs0), ‚ãÉ(hs0 ‚ãÇ P(s0)), P(c1), ‚ãÉ(c0 ‚ãÇ P(s0)), hs0 = c0)
  pweqd(‚ãÉ hs0, c1, hs0 = c0)
  syl6eqr(‚ãÉ hs0, c1, ‚ãÉ c0, hs0 = c0)
  unieq(hs0, c0)
  unieqd((hs0 ‚ãÇ P(s0)), (c0 ‚ãÇ P(s0)), hs0 = c0)
  ineq1(hs0, c0, P(s0))
  df-ntr(hs0, s0)
  diff.cpw.s(s0, c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(ctop)
  diff.hs0.c((s0 ‚àà P(c1)‚Ü¶ ‚ãÉ(c0 ‚ãÇ P(s0))))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, hs0, c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: clsfval
blocks.content: The closure function on the subsets of a topology's base set. (Contributed by NM, 3-Oct-2006.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 11-Nov-2013.)
blocks.origin:
thm clsfval(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, ctop), wceq(cfv(ccl, c0), cmpt(s0, cpw(c1), cint(crab(s1, cfv(ccld, c0), wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)))))))
  -| wceq(c1, cuni(c0))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  mpdan(wcel(c0, ctop), wceq(cfv(ccl, c0), cmpt(s0, cpw(c1), cint(crab(s1, cfv(ccld, c0), wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)))))), wcel(cmpt(s0, cpw(c1), cint(crab(s1, cfv(ccld, c0), wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), universe))
  3syl(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(cmpt(s0, cpw(c1), cint(crab(s1, cfv(ccld, c0), wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), universe), wcel(c1, c0), wcel(cpw(c1), universe))
  topopn(c0, c1)
  pwexg(c1, c0)
  mptexg(s0, cpw(c1), universe, cint(crab(s1, cfv(ccld, c0), wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)))))
  fvmptg(hs0, c0, ctop, cmpt(s0, cpw(c1), cint(crab(s1, cfv(ccld, c0), wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), universe, ccl, cmpt(s0, cpw(cuni(cv(hs0))), cint(crab(s1, cfv(ccld, cv(hs0)), wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))))))
  mpteq12dv(s0, cpw(cuni(cv(hs0))), cint(crab(s1, cfv(ccld, cv(hs0)), wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), cpw(c1), cint(crab(s1, cfv(ccld, c0), wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  pweqd(cuni(cv(hs0)), c1, wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  syl6eqr(cuni(cv(hs0)), c1, cuni(c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  unieq(cv(hs0), c0)
  inteqd(crab(s1, cfv(ccld, cv(hs0)), wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))), crab(s1, cfv(ccld, c0), wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  rabeqdv(s1, cfv(ccld, cv(hs0)), cfv(ccld, c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)))
  fveq2(cv(hs0), c0, ccld)
  df-cls(hs0, s0, s1)
  diff.cpw.s(s0, c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(ctop)
  diff.hs0.c(cmpt(s0, cpw(c1), cint(crab(s1, cfv(ccld, c0), wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))))))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(hs0), c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.cfv.s(s1, ccld, cv(hs0))
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.cfv.s(s1, ccld, c0)
  diff.ccld.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm clsfval(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà Top ‚Üí(cls ` c0)=(s0 ‚àà P(c1)‚Ü¶ ‚ãÇ { s1 ‚àà(Clsd ` c0)| s0 ‚äÜ s1 }))
  ‚ä£ c1 = ‚ãÉ c0
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c0)
} = {
  mpdan(c0 ‚àà Top, (cls ` c0)=(s0 ‚àà P(c1)‚Ü¶ ‚ãÇ { s1 ‚àà(Clsd ` c0)| s0 ‚äÜ s1 }), (s0 ‚àà P(c1)‚Ü¶ ‚ãÇ { s1 ‚àà(Clsd ` c0)| s0 ‚äÜ s1 })‚àà ùïå)
  3syl(c0 ‚àà Top, (s0 ‚àà P(c1)‚Ü¶ ‚ãÇ { s1 ‚àà(Clsd ` c0)| s0 ‚äÜ s1 })‚àà ùïå, c1 ‚àà c0, P(c1)‚àà ùïå)
  topopn(c0, c1)
  pwexg(c1, c0)
  mptexg(s0, P(c1), universe, ‚ãÇ { s1 ‚àà(Clsd ` c0)| s0 ‚äÜ s1 })
  fvmptg(hs0, c0, ctop, (s0 ‚àà P(c1)‚Ü¶ ‚ãÇ { s1 ‚àà(Clsd ` c0)| s0 ‚äÜ s1 }), universe, ccl, (s0 ‚àà P(‚ãÉ hs0)‚Ü¶ ‚ãÇ { s1 ‚àà(Clsd ` hs0)| s0 ‚äÜ s1 }))
  mpteq12dv(s0, P(‚ãÉ hs0), ‚ãÇ { s1 ‚àà(Clsd ` hs0)| s0 ‚äÜ s1 }, P(c1), ‚ãÇ { s1 ‚àà(Clsd ` c0)| s0 ‚äÜ s1 }, hs0 = c0)
  pweqd(‚ãÉ hs0, c1, hs0 = c0)
  syl6eqr(‚ãÉ hs0, c1, ‚ãÉ c0, hs0 = c0)
  unieq(hs0, c0)
  inteqd({ s1 ‚àà(Clsd ` hs0)| s0 ‚äÜ s1 }, { s1 ‚àà(Clsd ` c0)| s0 ‚äÜ s1 }, hs0 = c0)
  rabeqdv(s1, (Clsd ` hs0), (Clsd ` c0), hs0 = c0, s0 ‚äÜ s1)
  fveq2(hs0, c0, ccld)
  df-cls(hs0, s0, s1)
  diff.cpw.s(s0, c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(ctop)
  diff.hs0.c((s0 ‚àà P(c1)‚Ü¶ ‚ãÇ { s1 ‚àà(Clsd ` c0)| s0 ‚äÜ s1 }))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, hs0, c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.cfv.s(s1, ccld, hs0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.cfv.s(s1, ccld, c0)
  diff.ccld.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
}

blocks.name: cldrcl
blocks.content: Reverse closure of the closed set operation. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 22-Feb-2015.)

blocks.name: iscld
blocks.content: The predicate "the class ` S ` is a closed set". (Contributed by NM, 2-Oct-2006.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 11-Nov-2013.)
blocks.origin:
thm iscld(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, ctop), wb(wcel(c1, cfv(ccld, c0)), wa(wss(c1, c2), wcel(cdif(c2, c1), c0))))
  -| wceq(c2, cuni(c0))
} = {
  bitrd(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(c1, cfv(ccld, c0)), wa(wss(c1, c2), wcel(cdif(c2, c1), c0)), wa(wcel(c1, cpw(c2)), wcel(cdif(c2, c1), c0)))
  syl6bb(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(c1, cfv(ccld, c0)), wa(wcel(c1, cpw(c2)), wcel(cdif(c2, c1), c0)), wcel(c1, crab(hs0, cpw(c2), wcel(cdif(c2, cv(hs0)), c0))))
  eleq2d(c1, cfv(ccld, c0), crab(hs0, cpw(c2), wcel(cdif(c2, cv(hs0)), c0)), wcel(c0, ctop))
  cldval(hs0, c0, c2)
  elrab(hs0, c1, cpw(c2), wcel(cdif(c2, cv(hs0)), c0), wcel(cdif(c2, c1), c0))
  eleq1d(cdif(c2, cv(hs0)), c0, cdif(c2, c1), wceq(cv(hs0), c1))
  difeq2(cv(hs0), c1, c2)
  anbi1d(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(c1, cpw(c2)), wcel(cdif(c2, c1), c0), wss(c1, c2))
  syl(wcel(c0, ctop), wb(wcel(c1, cpw(c2)), wss(c1, c2)), wcel(c2, c0))
  topopn(c0, c2)
  elpw2g(c2, c0, c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(cpw(c2))
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(cdif(c2, c1), c0))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm iscld(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà Top ‚Üí(c1 ‚àà(Clsd ` c0)‚Üî(c1 ‚äÜ c2 ‚àß(c2 \ c1)‚àà c0)))
  ‚ä£ c2 = ‚ãÉ c0
} = {
  bitrd(c0 ‚àà Top, c1 ‚àà(Clsd ` c0), (c1 ‚äÜ c2 ‚àß(c2 \ c1)‚àà c0), (c1 ‚àà P(c2)‚àß(c2 \ c1)‚àà c0))
  syl6bb(c0 ‚àà Top, c1 ‚àà(Clsd ` c0), (c1 ‚àà P(c2)‚àß(c2 \ c1)‚àà c0), c1 ‚àà { hs0 ‚àà P(c2)|(c2 \ hs0)‚àà c0 })
  eleq2d(c1, (Clsd ` c0), { hs0 ‚àà P(c2)|(c2 \ hs0)‚àà c0 }, c0 ‚àà Top)
  cldval(hs0, c0, c2)
  elrab(hs0, c1, P(c2), (c2 \ hs0)‚àà c0, (c2 \ c1)‚àà c0)
  eleq1d((c2 \ hs0), c0, (c2 \ c1), hs0 = c1)
  difeq2(hs0, c1, c2)
  anbi1d(c0 ‚àà Top, c1 ‚àà P(c2), (c2 \ c1)‚àà c0, c1 ‚äÜ c2)
  syl(c0 ‚àà Top, (c1 ‚àà P(c2)‚Üî c1 ‚äÜ c2), c2 ‚àà c0)
  topopn(c0, c2)
  elpw2g(c2, c0, c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(P(c2))
  diff.hs0.w((c2 \ c1)‚àà c0)
}

blocks.name: iscld2
blocks.content: A subset of the underlying set of a topology is closed iff its complement is open. (Contributed by NM, 4-Oct-2006.)

blocks.name: cldss
blocks.content: A closed set is a subset of the underlying set of a topology. (Contributed by NM, 5-Oct-2006.) (Revised by Stefan O'Rear, 22-Feb-2015.)

blocks.name: cldss2
blocks.content: The set of closed sets is contained in the powerset of the base. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 6-Jan-2014.)

blocks.name: cldopn
blocks.content: The complement of a closed set is open. (Contributed by NM, 5-Oct-2006.) (Revised by Stefan O'Rear, 22-Feb-2015.)

blocks.name: isopn2
blocks.content: A subset of the underlying set of a topology is open iff its complement is closed. (Contributed by NM, 4-Oct-2006.)

blocks.name: opncld
blocks.content: The complement of an open set is closed. (Contributed by NM, 6-Oct-2006.)

blocks.name: difopn
blocks.content: The difference of a closed set with an open set is open. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 6-Jan-2014.)

thm difopn(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {

  elssuni(c0, c1)
  df-ss(c0, c3)

  indif2(c0, c3, c2)
  syl3anc(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c1))), wcel(cin(c0, cdif(c3, c2)), c1), wcel(c1, ctop), wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cdif(c3, c2), c1))
  adantl(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c1)), wcel(c1, ctop))
  cldrcl(c2, c1)
  simpl(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c1)))
  adantl(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c1)), wcel(cdif(c3, c2), c1))

  indif2(c0, c3, c2)

blocks.name: topcld
blocks.content: The underlying set of a topology is closed. Part of Theorem 6.1(1) of [Munkres] p. 93. (Contributed by NM, 3-Oct-2006.)

blocks.name: ntrval
blocks.content: The interior of a subset of a topology's base set is the union of all the open sets it includes. Definition of interior of [Munkres] p. 94. (Contributed by NM, 10-Sep-2006.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 11-Nov-2013.)

  ineq2d(c0, cpw(cv(hs0)), cpw(c1), wceq(cv(hs0), c1))
  pweq(cv(hs0), c1)
  biimpar(wcel(c0, ctop), wss(c1, c2), wcel(c1, cpw(c2)))

blocks.name: clsval
blocks.content: The closure of a subset of a topology's base set is the intersection of all the closed sets that include it. Definition of closure of [Munkres] p. 94. (Contributed by NM, 10-Sep-2006.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 11-Nov-2013.)
blocks.origin:
thm clsval(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2) {

  -| wceq(c2, cuni(c0))

} = {

  adantr(wcel(c0, ctop), wss(c1, c2), wceq(cfv(cfv(ccl, c0), c1), cfv(cmpt(hs0, cpw(c2), cint(crab(s0, cfv(ccld, c0), wss(cv(hs0), cv(s0))))), c1)))

  clsfval(hs0, s0, c0, c2)
  fvmptd3(hs0, cmpt(hs0, cpw(c2), cint(crab(s0, cfv(ccld, c0), wss(cv(hs0), cv(s0))))), c1, cint(crab(s0, cfv(ccld, c0), wss(c1, cv(s0)))), cpw(c2), cint(crab(s0, cfv(ccld, c0), wss(cv(hs0), cv(s0)))), universe, wa(wcel(c0, ctop), wss(c1, c2)))
  eqid(cmpt(hs0, cpw(c2), cint(crab(s0, cfv(ccld, c0), wss(cv(hs0), cv(s0))))))
  inteqd(crab(s0, cfv(ccld, c0), wss(cv(hs0), cv(s0))), crab(s0, cfv(ccld, c0), wss(c1, cv(s0))), wceq(cv(hs0), c1))

  elpw2g(c2, c0, c1)
  sylib(wa(wcel(c0, ctop), wss(c1, c2)), wcel(cint(crab(s0, cfv(ccld, c0), wss(c1, cv(s0)))), universe), wrex(s0, cfv(ccld, c0), wss(c1, cv(s0))))
  sylan(wcel(c0, ctop), wss(c1, c2), wrex(s0, cfv(ccld, c0), wss(c1, cv(s0))), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0)))
  topcld(c0, c2)

thm iincld(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚â† ‚àÖ ‚àß ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c0, c1 ‚àà(Clsd ` c2)))‚Üí ‚ãÇ(s0 ‚àà c0, c1)‚àà(Clsd ` c2))

} = {
  eqeltrd(‚ãÇ(s0 ‚àà c0, c1), (Clsd ` c2), (‚ãÉ c2 \ ‚ãÉ(s0 ‚àà c0,(‚ãÉ c2 \ c1))), (c0 ‚â† ‚àÖ ‚àß ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c0, c1 ‚àà(Clsd ` c2))))
  eqtr3d(‚ãÇ(s0 ‚àà c0, c1), (‚ãÉ c2 \ ‚ãÉ(s0 ‚àà c0,(‚ãÉ c2 \ c1))), ‚ãÇ(s0 ‚àà c0,(‚ãÉ c2 \(‚ãÉ c2 \ c1))), (c0 ‚â† ‚àÖ ‚àß ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c0, c1 ‚àà(Clsd ` c2))))

  syl(‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c0, c1 ‚àà(Clsd ` c2)), ‚ãÇ(s0 ‚àà c0,(‚ãÉ c2 \(‚ãÉ c2 \ c1)))= ‚ãÇ(s0 ‚àà c0, c1), ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c0,(‚ãÉ c2 \(‚ãÉ c2 \ c1))= c1))

  iindif2(s0, c0, ‚ãÉ c2, (‚ãÉ c2 \ c1))

blocks.name: uncld
blocks.content: The union of two closed sets is closed. Equivalent to Theorem 6.1(3) of [Munkres] p. 93. (Contributed by NM, 5-Oct-2006.)
blocks.origin:
thm uncld(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ccld, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c1))), wcel(cun(c0, c2), cfv(ccld, c1)))
} = {
  mpbird(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ccld, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c1))), wcel(cun(c0, c2), cfv(ccld, c1)), wcel(cdif(cuni(c1), cun(c0, c2)), c1))
  syl5eqel(cdif(cuni(c1), cun(c0, c2)), c1, cin(cdif(cuni(c1), c0), cdif(cuni(c1), c2)), wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ccld, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c1))))
  difundi(cuni(c1), c0, c2)
  syl2an3an(wcel(c0, cfv(ccld, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c1)), wcel(cin(cdif(cuni(c1), c0), cdif(cuni(c1), c2)), c1), wcel(c1, ctop), wcel(cdif(cuni(c1), c0), c1), wcel(cdif(cuni(c1), c2), c1))
  cldopn(c0, c1, cuni(c1))
  cldopn(c2, c1, cuni(c1))
  inopn(c1, cdif(cuni(c1), c0), cdif(cuni(c1), c2))
  syl2an2r(wcel(c0, cfv(ccld, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c1)), wb(wcel(cun(c0, c2), cfv(ccld, c1)), wcel(cdif(cuni(c1), cun(c0, c2)), c1)), wcel(c1, ctop), wss(cun(c0, c2), cuni(c1)))
  cldrcl(c0, c1)
  sylib(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ccld, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c1))), wss(cun(c0, c2), cuni(c1)), wa(wss(c0, cuni(c1)), wss(c2, cuni(c1))))
  anim12i(wcel(c0, cfv(ccld, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c1)), wss(c0, cuni(c1)), wss(c2, cuni(c1)))
  cldss(c0, c1, cuni(c1))
  cldss(c2, c1, cuni(c1))
  unss(c0, cuni(c1), c2)
  iscld2(c1, cun(c0, c2), cuni(c1))
  eqid(cuni(c1))
}

thm uncld(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà(Clsd ` c1)‚àß c2 ‚àà(Clsd ` c1))‚Üí(c0 ‚ãÉ c2)‚àà(Clsd ` c1))
} = {
  mpbird((c0 ‚àà(Clsd ` c1)‚àß c2 ‚àà(Clsd ` c1)), (c0 ‚ãÉ c2)‚àà(Clsd ` c1), (‚ãÉ c1 \(c0 ‚ãÉ c2))‚àà c1)
  syl5eqel((‚ãÉ c1 \(c0 ‚ãÉ c2)), c1, ((‚ãÉ c1 \ c0)‚ãÇ(‚ãÉ c1 \ c2)), (c0 ‚àà(Clsd ` c1)‚àß c2 ‚àà(Clsd ` c1)))

  cldopn(c0, c1, ‚ãÉ c1)

  inopn(c1, (‚ãÉ c1 \ c0), (‚ãÉ c1 \ c2))

  cldrcl(c0, c1)
  sylib((c0 ‚àà(Clsd ` c1)‚àß c2 ‚àà(Clsd ` c1)), (c0 ‚ãÉ c2)‚äÜ ‚ãÉ c1, (c0 ‚äÜ ‚ãÉ c1 ‚àß c2 ‚äÜ ‚ãÉ c1))
  anim12i(c0 ‚àà(Clsd ` c1), c2 ‚àà(Clsd ` c1), c0 ‚äÜ ‚ãÉ c1, c2 ‚äÜ ‚ãÉ c1)

thm cldcls(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cfv(ccld, c1)), wceq(cfv(cfv(ccl, c1), c0), c0))

  syl2anc(wcel(c0, cfv(ccld, c1)), wceq(cfv(cfv(ccl, c1), c0), cint(crab(hs0, cfv(ccld, c1), wss(c0, cv(hs0))))), wcel(c1, ctop), wss(c0, cuni(c1)))

  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cuni(c1))

blocks.content: An indexed relative intersection of closed sets is closed. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 22-Feb-2015.)

thm riincld(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, ctop), wral(s0, c1, wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0)))), wcel(cin(c3, ciin(s0, c1, c2)), cfv(ccld, c0)))
  -| wceq(c3, cuni(c0))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
} = {
  pm2.61dane(c1, emptycls, wa(wcel(c0, ctop), wral(s0, c1, wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0)))), wcel(cin(c3, ciin(s0, c1, c2)), cfv(ccld, c0)))
  eqeltrd(cin(c3, ciin(s0, c1, c2)), cfv(ccld, c0), c3, wa(wa(wcel(c0, ctop), wral(s0, c1, wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0)))), wceq(c1, emptycls)))
  adantl(wa(wcel(c0, ctop), wral(s0, c1, wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0)))), wceq(c1, emptycls), wceq(cin(c3, ciin(s0, c1, c2)), c3))
  riin0(s0, c1, c3, c2)
  ad2antrr(wcel(c0, ctop), wral(s0, c1, wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0))), wceq(c1, emptycls), wcel(c3, cfv(ccld, c0)))
  syl2anc(wa(wa(wcel(c0, ctop), wral(s0, c1, wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0)))), wne(c1, emptycls)), wcel(cin(c3, ciin(s0, c1, c2)), cfv(ccld, c0)), wcel(c3, cfv(ccld, c0)), wcel(ciin(s0, c1, c2), cfv(ccld, c0)))
  ad2antrr(wcel(c0, ctop), wral(s0, c1, wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0))), wne(c1, emptycls), wcel(c3, cfv(ccld, c0)))
  topcld(c0, c3)
  syl2anc(wa(wa(wcel(c0, ctop), wral(s0, c1, wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0)))), wne(c1, emptycls)), wcel(ciin(s0, c1, c2), cfv(ccld, c0)), wne(c1, emptycls), wral(s0, c1, wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0))))
  simpr(wa(wcel(c0, ctop), wral(s0, c1, wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0)))), wne(c1, emptycls))
  simplr(wcel(c0, ctop), wral(s0, c1, wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0))), wne(c1, emptycls))
  iincld(s0, c1, c2, c0)
  incld(c3, c0, ciin(s0, c1, c2))
}

  syl2anc(((c0 ‚àà Top ‚àß ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c1, c2 ‚àà(Clsd ` c0)))‚àß c1 ‚â† ‚àÖ), (c3 ‚ãÇ ‚ãÇ(s0 ‚àà c1, c2))‚àà(Clsd ` c0), c3 ‚àà(Clsd ` c0), ‚ãÇ(s0 ‚àà c1, c2)‚àà(Clsd ` c0))

thm iuncld(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(c1, cfn), wral(s0, c1, wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0)))), wcel(ciun(s0, c1, c2), cfv(ccld, c0)))

  eqeltrrd(ciun(s0, c1, c2), cfv(ccld, c0), cdif(c3, cin(c3, ciin(s0, c1, cdif(c3, c2)))), w3a(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(c1, cfn), wral(s0, c1, wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0)))))

  eqtr4i(cdif(c3, cin(c3, ciin(s0, c1, cdif(c3, c2)))), ciun(s0, c1, cdif(c3, cdif(c3, c2))), cdif(c3, ciin(s0, c1, cdif(c3, c2))))
  difin(c3, ciin(s0, c1, cdif(c3, c2)))

  syl(w3a(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(c1, cfn), wral(s0, c1, wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0)))), wceq(ciun(s0, c1, cdif(c3, cdif(c3, c2))), ciun(s0, c1, c2)), wral(s0, c1, wceq(cdif(c3, cdif(c3, c2)), c2)))
  3ad2ant3(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(c1, cfn), wral(s0, c1, wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0))), wral(s0, c1, wceq(cdif(c3, cdif(c3, c2)), c2)))
  ralimi(s0, c1, wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0)), wceq(cdif(c3, cdif(c3, c2)), c2))
  sylib(wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0)), wceq(cdif(c3, cdif(c3, c2)), c2), wss(c2, c3))
  cldss(c2, c0, c3)
  dfss4(c2, c3)
  iuneq2(s0, c1, cdif(c3, cdif(c3, c2)), c2)
  syl2anc(w3a(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(c1, cfn), wral(s0, c1, wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0)))), wcel(cdif(c3, cin(c3, ciin(s0, c1, cdif(c3, c2)))), cfv(ccld, c0)), wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(cin(c3, ciin(s0, c1, cdif(c3, c2))), c0))
  simp1(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(c1, cfn), wral(s0, c1, wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0))))
  syl3an3(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(c1, cfn), wral(s0, c1, wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0))), wcel(cin(c3, ciin(s0, c1, cdif(c3, c2))), c0), wral(s0, c1, wcel(cdif(c3, c2), c0)))

  riinopn(s0, c0, c1, cdif(c3, c2), c3)

  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà Top ‚àß c1 ‚àà Fin ‚àß ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c1, c2 ‚àà(Clsd ` c0)))‚Üí ‚ãÉ(s0 ‚àà c1, c2)‚àà(Clsd ` c0))

blocks.name: unicld
blocks.content: A finite union of closed sets is closed. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 19-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm unicld(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(c1, cfn), wss(c1, cfv(ccld, c0))), wcel(cuni(c1), cfv(ccld, c0)))
  -| wceq(c2, cuni(c0))
} = {
  syl5eqel(cuni(c1), cfv(ccld, c0), ciun(hs0, c1, cv(hs0)), w3a(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(c1, cfn), wss(c1, cfv(ccld, c0))))
  uniiun(hs0, c1)
  syl3an3b(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(c1, cfn), wss(c1, cfv(ccld, c0)), wcel(ciun(hs0, c1, cv(hs0)), cfv(ccld, c0)), wral(hs0, c1, wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(ccld, c0))))
  dfss3(hs0, c1, cfv(ccld, c0))
  iuncld(hs0, c0, c1, cv(hs0), c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(ccld, c0))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
}

  anim1i(wcel(c0, ctop), wss(c1, c2), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0)))
  topcld(c0, c2)

  sseq2(cv(hs0), c2, c1)

thm clsss(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {

  adantr(wss(c3, c1), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(ccld, c0)), wi(wss(c1, cv(hs0)), wss(c3, cv(hs0))))
  sstr2(c3, c1, cv(hs0))

  syl2anc(w3a(wcel(c0, ctop), wss(c1, c2), wss(c3, c1)), wceq(cfv(cfv(ccl, c0), c3), cint(crab(hs0, cfv(ccld, c0), wss(c3, cv(hs0))))), wcel(c0, ctop), wss(c3, c2))

  simp1(c0 ‚àà Top, c1 ‚äÜ c2, c3 ‚äÜ c1)

thm ntrss(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {

  jctil(wa(wss(c1, c2), wss(c3, c1)), wss(cdif(c2, c3), c2), wss(cdif(c2, c1), cdif(c2, c3)))
  adantl(wss(c1, c2), wss(c3, c1), wss(cdif(c2, c1), cdif(c2, c3)))

thm ssntr(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wa(wa(wcel(c0, ctop), wss(c1, c2)), wa(wcel(c3, c0), wss(c3, c1))), wss(c3, cfv(cfv(cnt, c0), c1)))

  elssuni(c3, cin(c0, cpw(c1)))
  adantr(wa(wcel(c0, ctop), wss(c1, c2)), wa(wcel(c3, c0), wss(c3, c1)), wceq(cfv(cfv(cnt, c0), c1), cuni(cin(c0, cpw(c1)))))

blocks.name: clsss3

blocks.content: Membership in a closure. (Contributed by NM, 5-Mar-2007.)
blocks.origin:
thm elcls2(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, ctop), wss(c1, c2)), wb(wcel(c3, cfv(cfv(ccl, c0), c1)), wa(wcel(c3, c2), wral(s0, c0, wi(wcel(c3, cv(s0)), wne(cin(cv(s0), c1), emptycls))))))
  -| wceq(c2, cuni(c0))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
} = {
  bitrd(wa(wcel(c0, ctop), wss(c1, c2)), wcel(c3, cfv(cfv(ccl, c0), c1)), wa(wcel(c3, c2), wral(s0, c0, wi(wcel(c3, cv(s0)), wne(cin(cv(s0), c1), emptycls)))), wa(wcel(c3, c2), wcel(c3, cfv(cfv(ccl, c0), c1))))
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, ctop), wss(c1, c2)), wb(wcel(c3, cfv(cfv(ccl, c0), c1)), wa(wcel(c3, c2), wcel(c3, cfv(cfv(ccl, c0), c1)))), wss(cfv(cfv(ccl, c0), c1), c2))
  clsss3(c0, c1, c2)
  pm4.71rd(wss(cfv(cfv(ccl, c0), c1), c2), wcel(c3, cfv(cfv(ccl, c0), c1)), wcel(c3, c2))
  ssel(cfv(cfv(ccl, c0), c1), c2, c3)
  pm5.32da(wa(wcel(c0, ctop), wss(c1, c2)), wcel(c3, c2), wcel(c3, cfv(cfv(ccl, c0), c1)), wral(s0, c0, wi(wcel(c3, cv(s0)), wne(cin(cv(s0), c1), emptycls))))
  3expa(wcel(c0, ctop), wss(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wb(wcel(c3, cfv(cfv(ccl, c0), c1)), wral(s0, c0, wi(wcel(c3, cv(s0)), wne(cin(cv(s0), c1), emptycls)))))
  elcls(s0, c0, c1, c2, c3)
}

  simp2(wcel(c0, ctop), wss(c1, c2), wcel(c3, cfv(cfv(ccl, c0), c1)))
  3impia(wcel(c0, ctop), wss(c1, c2), wcel(c3, cfv(cfv(ccl, c0), c1)), wcel(c3, c2))
  sseld(c3, cfv(cfv(ccl, c0), c1), c2, wa(wcel(c0, ctop), wss(c1, c2)))
  clsss3(c0, c1, c2)
  simp3(wcel(c0, ctop), wss(c1, c2), wcel(c3, cfv(cfv(ccl, c0), c1)))
  biimpa(w3a(wcel(c0, ctop), wss(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wcel(c3, cfv(cfv(ccl, c0), c1)), wral(hs0, c0, wi(wcel(c3, cv(hs0)), wne(cin(cv(hs0), c1), emptycls))))
  elcls(hs0, c0, c1, c2, c3)

  imbi12d(wceq(cv(hs0), c4), wcel(c3, cv(hs0)), wne(cin(cv(hs0), c1), emptycls), wcel(c3, c4), wne(cin(c4, c1), emptycls))
  eleq2(cv(hs0), c4, c3)
  neeq1d(cin(cv(hs0), c1), emptycls, cin(c4, c1), wceq(cv(hs0), c4))

  diff.hs0.c(c0)

blocks.name: cldmre

blocks.name: opncldf1
blocks.content: A bijection useful for converting statements about open sets to statements about closed sets and vice versa. (Contributed by Jeff Hankins, 27-Aug-2009.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 1-Sep-2015.)

thm opncldf1(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, ctop), wa(wf1o(c1, c0, cfv(ccld, c0)), wceq(ccnv(c1), cmpt(s0, cfv(ccld, c0), cdif(c2, cv(s0))))))
  -| wceq(c2, cuni(c0))
  -| wceq(c1, cmpt(s1, c0, cdif(c2, cv(s1))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(wcel(c0, ctop), wa(wf1o(c1, c0, cfv(ccld, c0)), wceq(ccnv(c1), cmpt(s0, cfv(ccld, c0), cdif(c2, cv(s0)))))), diffsc(s0, c1))
  f1ocnv2d(s0, s1, c1, c0, cfv(ccld, c0), cdif(c2, cv(s0)), cdif(c2, cv(s1)), wcel(c0, ctop))
  opncld(c0, cv(s1), c2)
  adantl(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(cv(s0), cfv(ccld, c0)), wcel(cdif(c2, cv(s0)), c0))
  cldopn(cv(s0), c0, c2)
  impbid(wa(wcel(c0, ctop), wa(wcel(cv(s1), c0), wcel(cv(s0), cfv(ccld, c0)))), wceq(cv(s1), cdif(c2, cv(s0))), wceq(cv(s0), cdif(c2, cv(s1))))
  syl5ibrcom(wa(wcel(c0, ctop), wa(wcel(cv(s1), c0), wcel(cv(s0), cfv(ccld, c0)))), wceq(cv(s1), cdif(c2, cv(s0))), wceq(cv(s0), cdif(c2, cv(s1))), wceq(cv(s0), cdif(c2, cdif(c2, cv(s0)))))
  eqcomd(cv(s0), cdif(c2, cdif(c2, cv(s0))), wa(wcel(c0, ctop), wa(wcel(cv(s1), c0), wcel(cv(s0), cfv(ccld, c0)))))
  sylib(wa(wcel(c0, ctop), wa(wcel(cv(s1), c0), wcel(cv(s0), cfv(ccld, c0)))), wceq(cdif(c2, cdif(c2, cv(s0))), cv(s0)), wss(cv(s0), c2))
  ad2antll(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(cv(s1), c0), wcel(cv(s0), cfv(ccld, c0)), wss(cv(s0), c2))
  cldss(cv(s0), c0, c2)
  dfss4(cv(s0), c2)
  eqeq2d(cv(s0), cdif(c2, cv(s1)), cdif(c2, cdif(c2, cv(s0))), wceq(cv(s1), cdif(c2, cv(s0))))
  difeq2(cv(s1), cdif(c2, cv(s0)), c2)
  syl5ibrcom(wa(wcel(c0, ctop), wa(wcel(cv(s1), c0), wcel(cv(s0), cfv(ccld, c0)))), wceq(cv(s0), cdif(c2, cv(s1))), wceq(cv(s1), cdif(c2, cv(s0))), wceq(cv(s1), cdif(c2, cdif(c2, cv(s1)))))
  eqcomd(cv(s1), cdif(c2, cdif(c2, cv(s1))), wa(wcel(c0, ctop), wa(wcel(cv(s1), c0), wcel(cv(s0), cfv(ccld, c0)))))
  sylib(wa(wcel(c0, ctop), wa(wcel(cv(s1), c0), wcel(cv(s0), cfv(ccld, c0)))), wceq(cdif(c2, cdif(c2, cv(s1))), cv(s1)), wss(cv(s1), c2))
  adantrr(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(cv(s1), c0), wcel(cv(s0), cfv(ccld, c0)), wss(cv(s1), c2))
  eltopss(c0, cv(s1), c2)
  dfss4(cv(s1), c2)
  eqeq2d(cv(s1), cdif(c2, cv(s0)), cdif(c2, cdif(c2, cv(s1))), wceq(cv(s0), cdif(c2, cv(s1))))
  difeq2(cv(s0), cdif(c2, cv(s1)), c2)
  diff.cfv.s(s0, ccld, c0)
  diff.ccld.s(s0)
  diff.cdif.s(s0, c2, cv(s1))

  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, ctop)

  diff.ctop.s(s1)
}

blocks.name: opncldf2
blocks.content: The values of the open-closed bijection. (Contributed by Jeff Hankins, 27-Aug-2009.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 1-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm opncldf2(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(c1, c0)), wceq(cfv(c2, c1), cdif(c3, c1)))
  -| wceq(c3, cuni(c0))
  -| wceq(c2, cmpt(s0, c0, cdif(c3, cv(s0))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
} = {
  syl2anc(wa(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(c1, c0)), wceq(cfv(c2, c1), cdif(c3, c1)), wcel(c1, c0), wcel(cdif(c3, c1), cfv(ccld, c0)))
  simpr(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(c1, c0))
  opncld(c0, c1, c3)
  fvmptg(s0, c1, c0, cdif(c3, c1), cfv(ccld, c0), c2, cdif(c3, cv(s0)))
  difeq2(cv(s0), c1, c3)
  diff.cdif.s(s0, c3, c1)
}

thm opncldf2(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà Top ‚àß c1 ‚àà c0)‚Üí(c2 ` c1)=(c3 \ c1))
  ‚ä£ c3 = ‚ãÉ c0
  ‚ä£ c2 =(s0 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶(c3 \ s0))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c3)
} = {
  syl2anc((c0 ‚àà Top ‚àß c1 ‚àà c0), (c2 ` c1)=(c3 \ c1), c1 ‚àà c0, (c3 \ c1)‚àà(Clsd ` c0))
  simpr(c0 ‚àà Top, c1 ‚àà c0)
  opncld(c0, c1, c3)
  fvmptg(s0, c1, c0, (c3 \ c1), (Clsd ` c0), c2, (c3 \ s0))
  difeq2(s0, c1, c3)
  diff.cdif.s(s0, c3, c1)
}

blocks.name: opncldf3
blocks.content: The values of the converse/inverse of the open-closed bijection. (Contributed by Jeff Hankins, 27-Aug-2009.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 1-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm opncldf3(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {

  -| wceq(c3, cuni(c1))
  -| wceq(c2, cmpt(s0, c1, cdif(c3, cv(s0))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
} = {
  eqtrd(cfv(ccnv(c2), c0), cdif(c3, c0), cfv(cmpt(hs0, cfv(ccld, c1), cdif(c3, cv(hs0))), c0), wcel(c0, cfv(ccld, c1)))
  fveq1d(ccnv(c2), c0, cmpt(hs0, cfv(ccld, c1), cdif(c3, cv(hs0))), wcel(c0, cfv(ccld, c1)))
  syl(wcel(c0, cfv(ccld, c1)), wceq(ccnv(c2), cmpt(hs0, cfv(ccld, c1), cdif(c3, cv(hs0)))), wcel(c1, ctop))
  cldrcl(c0, c1)

  opncldf1(hs0, s0, c1, c2, c3)
  mpdan(wcel(c0, cfv(ccld, c1)), wceq(cfv(cmpt(hs0, cfv(ccld, c1), cdif(c3, cv(hs0))), c0), cdif(c3, c0)), wcel(cdif(c3, c0), c1))
  cldopn(c0, c1, c3)
  fvmptg(hs0, c0, cfv(ccld, c1), cdif(c3, c0), c1, cmpt(hs0, cfv(ccld, c1), cdif(c3, cv(hs0))), cdif(c3, cv(hs0)))
  difeq2(cv(hs0), c0, c3)
  eqid(cmpt(hs0, cfv(ccld, c1), cdif(c3, cv(hs0))))
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)

thm opncldf3(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà(Clsd ` c1)‚Üí(`' c2 ` c0)=(c3 \ c0))
  ‚ä£ c3 = ‚ãÉ c1
  ‚ä£ c2 =(s0 ‚àà c1 ‚Ü¶(c3 \ s0))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c3)
} = {

  opncldf1(hs0, s0, c1, c2, c3)
  mpdan(c0 ‚àà(Clsd ` c1), ((hs0 ‚àà(Clsd ` c1)‚Ü¶(c3 \ hs0))` c0)=(c3 \ c0), (c3 \ c0)‚àà c1)
  cldopn(c0, c1, c3)
  fvmptg(hs0, c0, (Clsd ` c1), (c3 \ c0), c1, (hs0 ‚àà(Clsd ` c1)‚Ü¶(c3 \ hs0)), (c3 \ hs0))
  difeq2(hs0, c0, c3)

blocks.name: isclo
blocks.content: A set ` A ` is clopen iff for every point ` x ` in the space there is a neighborhood ` y ` such that all the points in ` y ` are in ` A ` iff ` x ` is. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 10-Mar-2015.)

blocks.name: isclo2
blocks.content: A set ` A ` is clopen iff for every point ` x ` in the space there is a neighborhood ` y ` of ` x ` which is either disjoint from ` A ` or contained in ` A ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Jul-2015.)

blocks.name: mretopd
blocks.content: A Moore collection which is closed under finite unions called _topological_; such a collection is the closed sets of a canonically associated topology. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 1-Feb-2015.)

blocks.name: toponmre
blocks.content: The topologies over a given base set form a Moore collection: the intersection of any family of them is a topology, including the empty (relative) intersection which gives the discrete topology ~ distop . (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 31-Jan-2015.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 5-May-2015.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: cldmreon
blocks.content: The closed sets of a topology over a set are a Moore collection over the same set. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 31-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: iscldtop
blocks.content: A family is the closed sets of a topology iff it is a Moore collection and closed under finite union. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 1-Feb-2015.)

blocks.name: mreclatdemoBAD
blocks.content: The closed subspaces of a topology-bearing module form a complete lattice. Demonstration for ~ mreclatBAD . (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 31-Jan-2015.) TODO ( ~ df-riota update): This proof uses the old ~ df-clat and references the required instance of ~ mreclatBAD as a hypothesis. When ~ mreclatBAD is corrected to become mreclat, delete this theorem and uncomment the mreclatdemo below.
blocks.origin:
thm mreclatdemoBAD(class c0) {

} = {
  syl(wcel(c0, cin(ctps, clmod)), wcel(cfv(cipo, cin(cfv(clss, c0), cfv(ccld, cfv(ctopn, c0)))), ccla), wcel(cin(cfv(clss, c0), cfv(ccld, cfv(ctopn, c0))), cfv(cmre, cuni(cfv(ctopn, c0)))))

  mp1i(wcel(c0, cin(ctps, clmod)), wcel(cfv(cmre, cuni(cfv(ctopn, c0))), cfv(cmre, cpw(cuni(cfv(ctopn, c0))))), wcel(cuni(cfv(ctopn, c0)), universe))
  uniex(cfv(ctopn, c0))
  fvex(ctopn, c0)
  mremre(cuni(cfv(ctopn, c0)), universe)
  eleqtrd(cfv(clss, c0), cfv(cmre, cuni(cfv(ctopn, c0))), cfv(cmre, cfv(cbs, c0)), wcel(c0, cin(ctps, clmod)))
